citation.article-title: Aureibacter tunicatorum gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from a coral reef sea squirt, and description of Flammeovirgaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Flammeovirgaceae (Flam.me.o.vir.ga′ce.ae. N.L. fem. n. Flammeovirga type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L fem. pl. n. Flammeovirgaceae the Flammeovirga family).
Encompasses Gram-negative bacteria retrieved mainly from soil and marine environments.
At the time of writing, the family comprises the genera Aureibacter, Flammeovirga, Flexithrix, Limibacter, Perexilibacter, Persicobacter, Rapidithrix and Sediminitomix.
Delineation of the family is determined primarily by phylogenetic information from 16S rRNA gene sequences.
Cells are rod-shaped, chemoheterotrophic and aerobic.
The DNA G+C contents of members of the family are 27–43 mol%.
The type genus of the family is Flammeovirga Takahashi et al. 2006.
